thread.title: Crazy Miami Dolphins fan goes viral for bravely going shirtless in MINUS 30 degrees during their NFL playoff game against the Kansas City Chiefs
thread.title_full: Crazy Miami Dolphins fan goes viral for bravely going shirtless in MINUS 30 degrees during their NFL playoff game against the Kansas City Chiefs

author: VNExplorer
title: Crazy Miami Dolphins fan goes viral for bravely going shirtless in MINUS 30 degrees during their NFL playoff game against the Kansas City Chiefs
text:
Water bottles inside of the stadium were seen turning to ice in only seconds Temperatures in Kansas City had dropped to dangerous levels below freezing DailyMail.com provides all the latest international sports news
A crazy Dolphins fan went viral after cameras caught him boldly going shirtless in Kansas City on Saturday night, despite the dangerously cold weather at Arrowhead Stadium.
The broadcast crew caught the fan standing up and yelling while wearing nothing more than a Dolphins hat.
Fans were subjected to a feel like temperature of minus 30 degrees during the NFL playoff game.
Videos from inside the stadium had showed water bottles freezing and turning into ice in seconds due to how cold the temperature was.
Fans had also been allowed to bring in blankets that donâ€™t have zippers or compartments as well as portable chargers and non-dry-cell batteries to power heated clothes.
This Dolphins fan is really shirtless in this weather ðŸ˜³pic.twitter.com/NvsaKcbrO1
â€” Complex Sports (@ComplexSports) January 14, 2024
A Dolphins fan went viral after appearing shirtless during the cold temperatures in Kansas city
Temperatures in Kanas City were expected to drop to dangerously cold levels during the game
Videos from inside the stadium showed bottles of water freezing into ice in mere seconds
Additionally, those who wish to protect themselves from the cold seats were allowed to bring in 3ftx5ft pieces of cardboard to sit on.
During both pregame warmups and the game, itself the field at Arrowhead appeared to be covered with a thin sheet of ice due to the frigid conditions.
It felt like -14 degrees with the wind chill around 9:00 am, per FOX 4 in Kansas City but that did not stop loads of fans from fighting through the conditions to come out and tailgate.
ESPN NFL analyst Robert Griffin III tweeted out the that Chiefs game should be postponed due to the weather much like the game between the Buffalo Bills and Pittsburgh Steelers.
